holidays.name: Hug a Newsman Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to appreciate the journalists, reporters, and news folks who keep us informed (and occasionally entertained or infuriated). Spread some unexpected love and maybe get a hug from your favorite news reporter!
holidays.origin: Originated in the early 2000s as a lighthearted way to celebrate the hard-working news community and add some warmth to the often serious world of news media.
holidays.funFact: Despite the sometimes tough news they deliver, many journalists admit they secretly enjoy hugs on this day—it boosts morale in newsroom offices!

holidays.name: International Pillow Fight Day
holidays.description: An epic worldwide pillow fight happening in public parks and city squares where participants gather to have a massive, fluffy battle with pillows! It's messy, silly, and a great stress reliever.
holidays.origin: Began in 2008 as a global event to promote spontaneous play and laugh-out-loud fun, often organized silently via social media for surprise gatherings.
holidays.funFact: The largest recorded pillow fight took place in Seattle and involved over 7,000 participants flinging feathers and laughter on a sunny day!

holidays.name: Caramel Popcorn Day
holidays.description: Celebrate this sweet and salty snack that's perfect for movie nights or anytime cravings. Caramel popcorn lovers take this day to indulge in the crunchy, buttery delight!
holidays.origin: The exact origin date is uncertain, but it gained traction as a food holiday in the late 20th century alongside the rise of gourmet popcorn flavors.
holidays.funFact: Caramel popcorn was reportedly a hit at the 1893 Chicago World's Fair, popularized by a candy company that invented a recipe turning plain popcorn into a luxury treat.

holidays.name: Tell a Story Day
holidays.description: A day to spark your creativity and share stories — whether by writing, telling, or performing aloud. Great for authors, teachers, and anyone who loves storytelling and sharing experiences.
holidays.origin: Established in the early 2000s to encourage literacy and the oral tradition of storytelling in communities and schools worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Some libraries host special storytelling marathons on this day, where storytellers attempt to chain endlessly connected stories for hours!
